data: Creates a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning emotional scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains approximately 5,000 text snippets collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
It is a dataset for understanding emotion in financial texts. It combines Artificial Intelligence and Semantic Web technologies to better recognize, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Incorporates entity-sentiment annotation to address the problem of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. Consisting of over 10,700 news headlines, this human-annotated dataset provides information on sentiment shifts specific to entities in financial news.

A dataset consisting of tokenized and annotated Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets through the analysis of language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relationships in financial documents with approximately 29,000 samples and 22 relationship types across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, organization-money). Extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Collected from various news sources and evaluated by human experts. It allows researchers to investigate how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, helping to identify and classify financial entities in text data.

Presents a multilingual financial NLP dataset containing real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high-level and low-level topics, which facilitates multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs combined with deep analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data to answer complex financial queries.
